headline: Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) Is Up 11.4% After Q1 Beat, Strong Broad Markets And Buybacks - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Earlier this week, Skyworks Solutions reported first-quarter 2026 results showing revenue of US$1,035.4 million and net income of US$79.2 million, alongside confirming March-quarter guidance of US$875 million to US$925 million and a US$0.71 per-share dividend payable in March. The company also completed a US$837.68 million share repurchase program covering 12,695,909 shares, while highlighting Broad Markets strength in areas such as Wi‑Fi 7, edge IoT, automotive connectivity and data center...

The company also completed a US$837.68 million share repurchase program covering 12,695,909 shares, while highlighting Broad Markets strength in areas such as Wi‑Fi 7, edge IoT, automotive connectivity and data center...

headline: Is Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) Now Fairly Priced After Recent 7 Day Share Price Rebound?
summary: If you are wondering whether Skyworks Solutions is starting to look like value or just another chip stock under pressure, this article will walk through what the current price may be implying. The shares recently closed at US$62.10, with a 7 day return of 11.4%, a 30 day return of 2.4%, and longer term returns of 3.6% decline year to date and 1.5% decline over the past year. These returns sit alongside a much weaker 3 year return of 42.9% decline and a 5 year return of 62.8% decline. This...
